reviews.review_msg: Gets along with students well, but his teaching is a little unorganized. Very little work (might be good to do some vocab drill and review grammar on your own) and he marks fairly.
C'est un prof genial! David was cares about his students and class is always fun and engaging. Fun class.
Great Prof. Fun Lectures and very helpful. She is also very Pretty! Tests are still hard you have to pay attention to a lot of detail.

I love French classes in general but Camille was so sweet, kind and funny! She's really passionate about the language and I loved how she also learned English, so it's easy to communicate with her when you need clarification. I actually enjoyed coming to class twice a week - it helps that I had a small class as well. Would love to have her again!
Great prof, never had so much fun in a class before.

Camille is such an enthusiastic, helpful, and friendly prof. She comes to class every day with a smile and excitedness to teach, and she provides such easy to follow notes and exercises. Would take another class with her in a heart beat!

Great class, great prof.  Really enjoyed the course.  The text book was expensive & we seemed to jump from chapter to chapter in an illogical order but apart from that, nothing to complain about.  The exams are fair, just need to study. Would recommend this prof for any French course!

I have been with Claire for my two French classes and I definitely love her. She is really helpful and is always there for help. She is a tough grader though. But, if you prof read your essays and practice listening, you will be good to go.

Claire is an amazing professor! If you want to learn French, she is the right prof. Each class was extraordinary and informative. She created very interesting assignments and I am sure that Claire spent a lot of time to prepare course materials.
Good prof, a little bit dull at times, but a nice lady nonetheless. She teaches her material very clearly, and is always ready to clarify and make corrections. Solid course!
Ya... don't take a class with her. She's dismissive; you ask her a question and she'll tell you, "Did you read the book? Because if you did, you'd understand it."

She's ok. I didn't find her to be terribly warm or gregarious - something I think is needed in a conversationally based class to kick things off. I missed having a cultural context to the class and the main book is expensive & useless, her WebCT notes are better at explaining concepts. Her tests, marking, etc are extremely fair no complaints there.

He is awesome! I looked forward to coming to class because of him. His personality is great, which makes learning french easy and fun. The only one thing I would improve in him is that he doesn't do enough oral work in class. But he's so fun and perfect and he brings baked things for his class!!

An absolutely incredible teacher, perfect mix of fun, talented, helpful, and genuinely intelligent. I'm scared of French classes without him. He takes an honest interest in his students, uses interesting teaching methods, and is very very cute. Cynical students beware! If you don't like French he'll just annoy you, because he really likes it c:

Extremely helpful and clear. Wants all his students to do well. Very enthusiastic and loves teaching. He's made me fall in love with french. Very friendly and patient! Patience is very important when teaching another language. Highly recommend his class!
Paola is an awesome professor, very friendly, caring, and helpful. I recommend her wholeheartedly.
